page.title: 15HARWICH'S WEEKLY NEWSPAPER
page.content: THE HARWICH AND MANNINGTREE STANDARD WAS FIRST PUBLISHED IN 1872. IT HAS BEEN IN PUBLICATION FOR WELL OVER 100 YEARS. THE PRESENT OFFICE IS IN DOVERCOURT HIGH STREET AND WAS BUILT ABOUT TEN YEARS AGO. EVERY WEEK 7500 COPIES OF THE STANDARD ARE PRINTED ALTHOUGH IT EXPECTS TO SELL ABOUT 7000. THERE IS ALSO A LOCAL EVENING NEWSPAPER WHICH COVERS THE COLCHESTER AND N.E.ESSEX AREA AS WELL AS HARWICH; BOTH PAPERS ARE PRINTED IN COLCHESTER. THE STANDARD USUALLY RECEIVES BETWEEN TEN AND FIFTEEN LETTERS EACH WEEK. MOST CORRESPONDENTS WRITE FAVOURABLY ABOUT THE ARTICLES PUBLISHED. THE JOURNALIST INTERVIEWED FELT THAT COURT CASES AND GOSSIP TYPE ARTICLES WERE THE MOST POPULAR. FOR MANY HOUSEBOUND AND ELDERLY THIS WAS THEIR LINK WITH THE OUTSIDE WORLD.
